review.title: The state-of-the-art in web-scale semantic information processing for cloud computing
review.abstract: Based on integrated infrastructure of resource sharing and computing in distributed environment, cloud computing involves the provision of dynamically scalable and provides virtualized resources as services over the Internet. These applications also bring a large scale heterogeneous and distributed information which pose a great challenge in terms of the semantic ambiguity. It is critical for application services in cloud computing environment to provide users intelligent service and precise information. Semantic information processing can help users deal with semantic ambiguity and information overload efficiently through appropriate semantic models and semantic information processing technology. The semantic information processing have been successfully employed in many fields such as the knowledge representation, natural language understanding, intelligent web search, etc. The purpose of this report is to give an overview of existing technologies for semantic information processing in cloud computing environment, to propose a research direction for addressing distributed semantic reasoning and parallel semantic computing by exploiting semantic information newly available in cloud computing environment.

metadata.title: The state-of-the-art in web-scale semantic information processing for cloud computing

sections.text: Cloud computing involves the provision of dynamically scalable and virtualized resources as services over the Internet. These applications also bring with them heterogeneous and distributed information on a large scale, which poses a major challenge in terms of semantic ambiguity. For application services in the cloud computing environment, it is crucial to provide users with intelligent service and accurate information. Semantic information processing can help users to deal efficiently with semantic ambiguity and information overload through appropriate semantic models and semantic information processing technology. Semantic information processing has been used successfully in many areas, such as knowledge representation, understanding of natural languages, intelligent web search, etc. The purpose of this report is to provide an overview of existing technologies for semantic information processing in the cloud computing environment, in order to propose a research direction for distributed semantic reasoning and parallel semantic data processing by integrating newly available semantic information into cloud computing semantic web computing.

sections.heading: 1 Introduction
sections.text: With the increasing popularity of Internet services such as web search, instant messaging platforms and image processing, as well as other types of third-party services on the Web, millions of users are giving millions of clicks to get information, bringing terabytes of valuable data that are being used to improve online performance and demand for real-time applications and high-speed data processing. It is also creating a critical bottleneck for many businesses to build large data centers to meet information needs.Cloud computing technology has emerged and is growing fast as a solution to these problems. sections.heading: 4.3.1 Parallel storage and querying
sections.text: Although the state-of-the-art distributed database such as HDFS [44] can store and manage web-based semantic information like other data, there is still much work to do to make this storage and query faster and more scalable. To store and query web-scale RDF triples in parallel, Yahoo builds grid computing using Hadoop in a batch processing model using clusters of hundreds of machines. It uses the parallel database Pig [11] to support data transformations such as projections, sorting, joining and compositions. However, Pig does not provide an index and requires complete parsing when updating. Unlike Pig, YARS2 [45] uses six different indexes in six data orders that support the Semantic Web Search Engine (SWSE).

sections.heading: 5 Conclusion
sections.text: The purpose of this survey was to describe and analyze the state of the art in semantic information processing on the web and to give the reader a sense of our excitement about the intellectual richness and breadth of the area. Web-scale semantic information processing holds the key to solving the semantic ambiguity that hampers the deployment of precise cloud services and the discovery of knowledge. The semantic web is an emerging research direction that performs various semantic processing tasks. Many semantic web techniques and ontology models have been used to underpin a semantic cloud service. Cloud ontology, parallel semantic processing and semantic cloud services applications have been covered in this study. In recent years, many research groups have invested great efforts in semantic cloud services and provided many great performances. The rich literature is growing around these topics. Nevertheless, there are still challenging issues in these areas, in particular the question of how to draw parallel conclusions, how much information can be used in the cloud, how much information is shared in the cloud environment, and how many of which are very muddled.

metadata.abstractText: Based on integrated infrastructure of resource sharing and computing in distributed environment, cloud computing involves the provision of dynamically scalable and provides virtualized resources as services over the Internet. These applications also bring a large scale heterogeneous and distributed information which pose a great challenge in terms of the semantic ambiguity. It is critical for application services in cloud computing environment to provide users intelligent service and precise information. Semantic information processing can help users deal with semantic ambiguity and information overload efficiently through appropriate semantic models and semantic information processing technology. The semantic information processing have been successfully employed in many fields such as the knowledge representation, natural language understanding, intelligent web search, etc. The purpose of this report is to give an overview of existing technologies for semantic information processing in cloud computing environment, to propose a research direction for addressing distributed semantic reasoning and parallel semantic computing by exploiting semantic information newly available in cloud computing environment.
